05928             cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::SIToFP, // signed int to float
05929                                  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
05930             break;
05931         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
05932         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
05933         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
05934         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
05935             if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && g->target.isa != Target::GENERIC)
05936                 PerformanceWarning(pos, "Conversion from unsigned int to float is slow. "
05937                                    "Use \"int\" if possible");
05938             cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::UIToFP, // unsigned int to float
05939                                  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
05940             break;
05941         case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
05942             // No-op cast.
05943             cast = exprVal;
05944             break;
05945         case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
05946             cast = ctx->FPCastInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
05947             break;
05948         default:
05949             FATAL("unimplemented");
05950         }
05951         break;
05952     }
05953     case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE: {
05954         llvm::Type *targetType = 
05955             fromType->IsUniformType() ? LLVMTypes::DoubleType :
05956                                         LLVMTypes::DoubleVectorType;
05957         switch (fromType->basicType) {
05958         case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
05959             if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && 
05960                 LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType == LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType)
05961                 // truncate i32 bool vector values to i1s
05962                 exprVal = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType, cOpName);
05963             cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::UIToFP, // unsigned int to double
05964                                  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
05965             break;
05966         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
05967         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
05968         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
05969         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
05970             cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::SIToFP, // signed int
05971                                  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
05972             break;
05973         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
05974         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
05975         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
05976         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
05977             cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::UIToFP, // unsigned int
05978                                  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
05979             break;
05980         case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
05981             cast = ctx->FPCastInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
05982             break;
05983         case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
05984             cast = exprVal;
05985             break;
05986         default:
05987             FATAL("unimplemented");
05988         }
05989         break;
05990     }
05991     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8: {
05992         llvm::Type *targetType = 
05993             fromType->IsUniformType() ? LLVMTypes::Int8Type :
05994                                         LLVMTypes::Int8VectorType;
05995         switch (fromType->basicType) {
05996         case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
05997             if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && 
05998                 LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType == LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType)
05999                 exprVal = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType, cOpName);
06000             cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
06001             break;
06002         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
06003         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
06004             cast = exprVal;
06005             break;
06006         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
06007         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
06008         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
06009         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
06010         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
06011         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
06012             cast = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
06013             break;
06014         case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
06015             cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToSI, // signed int
06016                                  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
06017             break;
06018         case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
06019             cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToSI, // signed int
06020                                  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
06021             break;
06022         default:
06023             FATAL("unimplemented");
06024         }
06025         break;
06026     }
06027     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8: {
06028         llvm::Type *targetType = 
06029             fromType->IsUniformType() ? LLVMTypes::Int8Type :
06030                                         LLVMTypes::Int8VectorType;
06031         switch (fromType->basicType) {
06032         case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
06033             if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && 
06034                 LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType == LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType)
06035                 exprVal = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType, cOpName);
06036             cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
06037             break;
06038         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
06039         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
06040             cast = exprVal;
06041             break;
06042         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
06043         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
06044         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
06045         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
06046         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
06047         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
06048             cast = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
06049             break;
06050         case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
06051             if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && g->target.isa != Target::GENERIC)
06052                 PerformanceWarning(pos, "Conversion from float to unsigned int is slow. "
06053                                    "Use \"int\" if possible");
06054             cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToUI, // unsigned int
06055                                  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
06056             break;
06057         case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
06058             if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && g->target.isa != Target::GENERIC)
06059                 PerformanceWarning(pos, "Conversion from double to unsigned int is slow. "
06060                                    "Use \"int\" if possible");
06061             cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToUI, // unsigned int
06062                                  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
06063             break;
06064         default:
06065             FATAL("unimplemented");
06066         }
06067         break;
06068     }
06069     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16: {
06070         llvm::Type *targetType = 
06071             fromType->IsUniformType() ? LLVMTypes::Int16Type :
06072                                         LLVMTypes::Int16VectorType;
06073         switch (fromType->basicType) {
06074         case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
06075             if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && 
06076                 LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType == LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType)
06077                 exprVal = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType, cOpName);
06078             cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
06079             break;
06080         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
06081             cast = ctx->SExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
06082             break;
06083         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
06084             cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
06085             break;
06086         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
06087         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
06088             cast = exprVal;
06089             break;
06090         case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
06091             cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToSI, // signed int
06092                                  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
06093             break;
06094         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
06095         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
06096         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
06097         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
06098             cast = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
06099             break;
06100         case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
06101             cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToSI, // signed int
06102                                  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
06103             break;
06104         default:
06105             FATAL("unimplemented");
06106         }
06107         break;
06108     }
06109     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16: {
06110         llvm::Type *targetType = 
06111             fromType->IsUniformType() ? LLVMTypes::Int16Type :
06112                                         LLVMTypes::Int16VectorType;
06113         switch (fromType->basicType) {
06114         case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
06115             if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && 
06116                 LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType == LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType)
06117                 exprVal = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType, cOpName);
06118             cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
06119             break;
06120         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
06121             cast = ctx->SExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
06122             break;
06123         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
06124             cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
06125             break;            
06126         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
06127         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
06128             cast = exprVal;
06129             break;
06130         case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
06131             if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && g->target.isa != Target::GENERIC)
06132                 PerformanceWarning(pos, "Conversion from float to unsigned int is slow. "
06133                                    "Use \"int\" if possible");
06134             cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToUI, // unsigned int
06135                                  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
06136             break;
06137         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
06138         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
06139         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
06140         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
06141             cast = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
06142             break;
06143         case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
06144             if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && g->target.isa != Target::GENERIC)
06145                 PerformanceWarning(pos, "Conversion from double to unsigned int is slow. "
06146                                    "Use \"int\" if possible");
06147             cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToUI, // unsigned int
06148                                  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
06149             break;
06150         default:
06151             FATAL("unimplemented");
06152         }
06153         break;
06154     }
06155     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32: {
06156         llvm::Type *targetType = 
06157             fromType->IsUniformType() ? LLVMTypes::Int32Type :
06158                                         LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType;
06159         switch (fromType->basicType) {
06160         case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
06161             if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && 
06162                 LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType == LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType)
06163                 exprVal = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType, cOpName);
06164             cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
06165             break;
06166         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
06167         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
06168             cast = ctx->SExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
06169             break;
06170         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
06171         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
06172             cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
06173             break;
06174         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
06175         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
06176             cast = exprVal;
06177             break;
06178         case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
06179             cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToSI, // signed int
06180                                  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
06181             break;
06182         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
06183         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
06184             cast = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
06185             break;
06186         case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
06187             cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToSI, // signed int
06188                                  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
06189             break;
06190         default:
06191             FATAL("unimplemented");
06192         }
06193         break;
06194     }
06195     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32: {
06196         llvm::Type *targetType = 
06197             fromType->IsUniformType() ? LLVMTypes::Int32Type :
06198                                         LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType;
06199         switch (fromType->basicType) {
06200         case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
06201             if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && 
06202                 LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType == LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType)
06203                 exprVal = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType, cOpName);
06204             cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
06205             break;
06206         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
06207         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
06208             cast = ctx->SExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
06209             break;
06210         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
06211         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
06212             cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
06213             break;            
06214         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
06215         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
06216             cast = exprVal;
06217             break;
06218         case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
06219             if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && g->target.isa != Target::GENERIC)
06220                 PerformanceWarning(pos, "Conversion from float to unsigned int is slow. "
06221                                    "Use \"int\" if possible");
06222             cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToUI, // unsigned int
06223                                  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
06224             break;
06225         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
06226         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
06227             cast = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
06228             break;
06229         case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
06230             if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && g->target.isa != Target::GENERIC)
06231                 PerformanceWarning(pos, "Conversion from double to unsigned int is slow. "
06232                                    "Use \"int\" if possible");
06233             cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToUI, // unsigned int
06234                                  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
06235             break;
06236         default:
06237             FATAL("unimplemented");
06238         }
06239         break;
06240     }
06241     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64: {
06242         llvm::Type *targetType = 
06243             fromType->IsUniformType() ? LLVMTypes::Int64Type : 
06244                                         LLVMTypes::Int64VectorType;
06245         switch (fromType->basicType) {
06246         case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
06247             if (fromType->IsVaryingType() &&
06248                 LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType == LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType)
06249                 exprVal = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType, cOpName);
06250             cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
06251             break;
06252         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
06253         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
06254         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
06255             cast = ctx->SExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
06256             break;
06257         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
06258         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
06259         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
06260             cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
06261             break;
06262         case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
06263             cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToSI, // signed int
06264                                  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
06265             break;
06266         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
06267         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
06268             cast = exprVal;
06269             break;
06270         case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
06271             cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToSI, // signed int
06272                                  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
06273             break;
06274         default:
06275             FATAL("unimplemented");
06276         }
06277         break;
06278     }
06279     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64: {
06280         llvm::Type *targetType = 
06281             fromType->IsUniformType() ? LLVMTypes::Int64Type : 
06282                                         LLVMTypes::Int64VectorType;
06283         switch (fromType->basicType) {
06284         case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
06285             if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && 
06286                 LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType == LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType)
06287                 exprVal = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType, cOpName);
06288             cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
06289             break;
06290         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
06291         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
06292         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
06293             cast = ctx->SExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
06294             break;
06295         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
06296         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
06297         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
06298             cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
06299             break;
06300         case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
06301             if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && g->target.isa != Target::GENERIC)
06302                 PerformanceWarning(pos, "Conversion from float to unsigned int64 is slow. "
06303                                    "Use \"int64\" if possible");
06304             cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToUI, // signed int
06305                                  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
06306             break;
06307         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
06308         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
06309             cast = exprVal;
06310             break;
06311         case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
06312             if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && g->target.isa != Target::GENERIC)
06313                 PerformanceWarning(pos, "Conversion from double to unsigned int64 is slow. "
06314                                    "Use \"int64\" if possible");
06315             cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToUI, // signed int
06316                                  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
06317             break;
06318         default:
06319             FATAL("unimplemented");
06320         }
06321         break;
06322     }
06323     case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL: {
06324         switch (fromType->basicType) {
06325         case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
06326             cast = exprVal;
06327             break;
06328         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
06329         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8: {
06330             llvm::Value *zero = fromType->IsUniformType() ? (llvm::Value *)LLVMInt8(0) : 
06331                 (llvm::Value *)LLVMInt8Vector((int8_t)0);
06332             cast = ctx->CmpInst(llvm::Instruction::ICmp, llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_NE,
06333                                 exprVal, zero, cOpName);
06334             break;
06335         }
06336         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
06337         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16: {
06338             llvm::Value *zero = fromType->IsUniformType() ? (llvm::Value *)LLVMInt16(0) : 
06339                 (llvm::Value *)LLVMInt16Vector((int16_t)0);
06340             cast = ctx->CmpInst(llvm::Instruction::ICmp, llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_NE,
06341                                 exprVal, zero, cOpName);
06342             break;
06343         }
06344         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
06345         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32: {
06346             llvm::Value *zero = fromType->IsUniformType() ? (llvm::Value *)LLVMInt32(0) : 
06347                 (llvm::Value *)LLVMInt32Vector(0);
06348             cast = ctx->CmpInst(llvm::Instruction::ICmp, llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_NE,
06349                                 exprVal, zero, cOpName);
06350             break;
06351         }
06352         case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT: {
06353             llvm::Value *zero = fromType->IsUniformType() ? (llvm::Value *)LLVMFloat(0.f) : 
06354                 (llvm::Value *)LLVMFloatVector(0.f);
06355             cast = ctx->CmpInst(llvm::Instruction::FCmp, llvm::CmpInst::FCMP_ONE,
06356                                 exprVal, zero, cOpName);
06357             break;
06358         }
06359         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
06360         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64: {
06361             llvm::Value *zero = fromType->IsUniformType() ? (llvm::Value *)LLVMInt64(0) : 
06362                 (llvm::Value *)LLVMInt64Vector((int64_t)0);
06363             cast = ctx->CmpInst(llvm::Instruction::ICmp, llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_NE,
06364                                 exprVal, zero, cOpName);
06365             break;
06366         }
06367         case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE: {
06368             llvm::Value *zero = fromType->IsUniformType() ? (llvm::Value *)LLVMDouble(0.) : 
06369                 (llvm::Value *)LLVMDoubleVector(0.);
06370             cast = ctx->CmpInst(llvm::Instruction::FCmp, llvm::CmpInst::FCMP_ONE,
06371                                 exprVal, zero, cOpName);
06372             break;
06373         }
06374         default:
06375             FATAL("unimplemented");
06376         }
06377 
06378         if (fromType->IsUniformType()) {
06379             if (toType->IsVaryingType() && 
06380                 LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType == LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType) {
06381                 // extend out to i32 bool values from i1 here.  then we'll
06382                 // turn into a vector below, the way it does for everyone
06383                 // else...
06384                 cast = ctx->SExtInst(cast, LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType->getElementType(),
06385                                      LLVMGetName(cast, "to_i32bool"));
06386             }
06387         }
06388         else
06389             // fromType->IsVaryingType())
06390             cast = ctx->I1VecToBoolVec(cast);
06391 
06392         break;
06393     }
06394     default:
06395         FATAL("unimplemented");
06396     }
06397 
06398     // If we also want to go from uniform to varying, replicate out the
06399     // value across the vector elements..
06400     if (toType->IsVaryingType() && fromType->IsUniformType())
06401         return ctx->SmearUniform(cast);
06402     else
06403         return cast;
06404 }
06405 
06406 
06407 // FIXME: fold this into the FunctionEmitContext::SmearUniform() method?
06408 
06409 /** Converts the given value of the given type to be the varying
06410     equivalent, returning the resulting value.
06411  */
06412 static llvm::Value *
06413 lUniformValueToVarying(FunctionEmitContext *ctx, llvm::Value *value,
06414                        const Type *type) {
06415     // nothing to do if it's already varying
06416     if (type->IsVaryingType())
06417         return value;
06418 
06419     // for structs/arrays/vectors, just recursively make their elements
06420     // varying (if needed) and populate the return value.
06421     const CollectionType *collectionType = CastType<CollectionType>(type);
06422     if (collectionType != NULL) {
06423         llvm::Type *llvmType = 
06424             type->GetAsVaryingType()->LLVMType(g->ctx);
06425         llvm::Value *retValue = llvm::UndefValue::get(llvmType);
06426 
06427         for (int i = 0; i < collectionType->GetElementCount(); ++i) {
06428             llvm::Value *v = ctx->ExtractInst(value, i, "get_element");
06429             v = lUniformValueToVarying(ctx, v, collectionType->GetElementType(i));
06430             retValue = ctx->InsertInst(retValue, v, i, "set_element");
06431         }
06432         return retValue;
06433     }
06434 
06435     // Otherwise we must have a uniform atomic or pointer type, so smear
06436     // its value across the vector lanes.
06437     Assert(CastType<AtomicType>(type) != NULL ||
06438            CastType<PointerType>(type) != NULL);
06439     return ctx->SmearUniform(value);
06440 }
06441 
06442 
06443 llvm::Value *
06444 TypeCastExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
06445     if (!expr)
06446         return NULL;
06447 
06448     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
06449     const Type *toType = GetType(), *fromType = expr->GetType();
06450     if (toType == NULL || fromType == NULL) {
06451         AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
06452         return NULL;
06453     }
06454 
06455     if (Type::Equal(toType, AtomicType::Void)) {
06456         // emit the code for the expression in case it has side-effects but
06457         // then we're done.
06458         (void)expr->GetValue(ctx);
06459         return NULL;
06460     }
06461 
06462     const PointerType *fromPointerType = CastType<PointerType>(fromType);
06463     const PointerType *toPointerType = CastType<PointerType>(toType);
06464     const ArrayType *toArrayType = CastType<ArrayType>(toType);
06465     const ArrayType *fromArrayType = CastType<ArrayType>(fromType);
06466     if (fromPointerType != NULL) {
06467         if (toArrayType != NULL) {
06468             return expr->GetValue(ctx);
06469         }
06470         else if (toPointerType != NULL) {
06471             llvm::Value *value = expr->GetValue(ctx);
06472             if (value == NULL)
06473                 return NULL;
06474 
06475             if (fromPointerType->IsSlice() == false &&
06476                 toPointerType->IsSlice() == true) {
06477                 // Convert from a non-slice pointer to a slice pointer by
06478                 // creating a slice pointer structure with zero offsets.
06479                 if (fromPointerType->IsUniformType())
06480                     value = ctx->MakeSlicePointer(value, LLVMInt32(0));
06481                 else
06482                     value = ctx->MakeSlicePointer(value, LLVMInt32Vector(0));
06483 
06484                 // FIXME: avoid error from unnecessary bitcast when all we
06485                 // need to do is the slice conversion and don't need to
06486                 // also do unif->varying conversions.  But this is really
06487                 // ugly logic.
06488                 if (value->getType() == toType->LLVMType(g->ctx))
06489                     return value;
06490             }
06491 
06492             if (fromType->IsUniformType() && toType->IsUniformType())
06493                 // bitcast to the actual pointer type
06494                 return ctx->BitCastInst(value, toType->LLVMType(g->ctx));
06495             else if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && toType->IsVaryingType()) {
06496                 // both are vectors of ints already, nothing to do at the IR
06497                 // level
06498                 return value;
06499             }
06500             else {
06501                 // Uniform -> varying pointer conversion
06502                 AssertPos(pos, fromType->IsUniformType() && toType->IsVaryingType());
06503                 if (fromPointerType->IsSlice()) {
06504                     // For slice pointers, we need to smear out both the
06505                     // pointer and the offset vector
06506                     AssertPos(pos, toPointerType->IsSlice());
06507                     llvm::Value *ptr = ctx->ExtractInst(value, 0);
06508                     llvm::Value *offset = ctx->ExtractInst(value, 1);
06509                     ptr = ctx->PtrToIntInst(ptr);
06510                     ptr = ctx->SmearUniform(ptr);
06511                     offset = ctx->SmearUniform(offset);
06512                     return ctx->MakeSlicePointer(ptr, offset);
06513                 }
06514                 else {
06515                     // Otherwise we just bitcast it to an int and smear it
06516                     // out to a vector
06517                     value = ctx->PtrToIntInst(value);
06518                     return ctx->SmearUniform(value);
06519                 }
06520             }
06521         }
06522         else {
06523             AssertPos(pos, CastType<AtomicType>(toType) != NULL);
06524             if (toType->IsBoolType()) {
06525                 // convert pointer to bool
06526                 llvm::Type *lfu = 
06527                     fromType->GetAsUniformType()->LLVMType(g->ctx);
06528                 llvm::PointerType *llvmFromUnifType = 
06529                     llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::PointerType>(lfu);
06530 
06531                 llvm::Value *nullPtrValue = 
06532                     llvm::ConstantPointerNull::get(llvmFromUnifType);
06533                 if (fromType->IsVaryingType())
06534                     nullPtrValue = ctx->SmearUniform(nullPtrValue);
06535 
06536                 llvm::Value *exprVal = expr->GetValue(ctx);
06537                 llvm::Value *cmp = 
06538                     ctx->CmpInst(llvm::Instruction::ICmp, llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_NE,
06539                                  exprVal, nullPtrValue, "ptr_ne_NULL");
06540 
06541                 if (toType->IsVaryingType()) {
06542                     if (fromType->IsUniformType())
06543                         cmp = ctx->SmearUniform(cmp);
06544                     cmp = ctx->I1VecToBoolVec(cmp);
06545                 }
06546 
06547                 return cmp;
06548             }
06549             else {
06550                 // ptr -> int
06551                 llvm::Value *value = expr->GetValue(ctx);
06552                 if (value == NULL)
06553                     return NULL;
06554 
06555                 if (toType->IsVaryingType() && fromType->IsUniformType())
06556                     value = ctx->SmearUniform(value);
06557 
06558                 llvm::Type *llvmToType = toType->LLVMType(g->ctx);
06559                 if (llvmToType == NULL)
06560                     return NULL;
06561                 return ctx->PtrToIntInst(value, llvmToType, "ptr_typecast");
06562             }
06563         }
06564     }
06565 
06566     if (Type::EqualIgnoringConst(toType, fromType))
06567         // There's nothing to do, just return the value.  (LLVM's type
06568         // system doesn't worry about constiness.)
06569         return expr->GetValue(ctx);
06570 
06571     if (fromArrayType != NULL && toPointerType != NULL) {
06572         // implicit array to pointer to first element
06573         Expr *arrayAsPtr = lArrayToPointer(expr);
06574         if (Type::EqualIgnoringConst(arrayAsPtr->GetType(), toPointerType) == false) {
06575             AssertPos(pos, PointerType::IsVoidPointer(toPointerType) ||
06576                    Type::EqualIgnoringConst(arrayAsPtr->GetType()->GetAsVaryingType(),
06577                                             toPointerType) == true);
06578             arrayAsPtr = new TypeCastExpr(toPointerType, arrayAsPtr, pos);
06579             arrayAsPtr = ::TypeCheck(arrayAsPtr);
06580             AssertPos(pos, arrayAsPtr != NULL);
06581             arrayAsPtr = ::Optimize(arrayAsPtr);
06582             AssertPos(pos, arrayAsPtr != NULL);
06583         }
06584         AssertPos(pos, Type::EqualIgnoringConst(arrayAsPtr->GetType(), toPointerType));
06585         return arrayAsPtr->GetValue(ctx);
06586     }
06587 
06588     // This also should be caught during typechecking
06589     AssertPos(pos, !(toType->IsUniformType() && fromType->IsVaryingType()));
06590 
06591     if (toArrayType != NULL && fromArrayType != NULL) {
06592         // cast array pointer from [n x foo] to [0 x foo] if needed to be able
06593         // to pass to a function that takes an unsized array as a parameter
06594         if (toArrayType->GetElementCount() != 0 && 
06595             (toArrayType->GetElementCount() != fromArrayType->GetElementCount()))
06596             Warning(pos, "Type-converting array of length %d to length %d",
06597                     fromArrayType->GetElementCount(), toArrayType->GetElementCount());
06598         AssertPos(pos, Type::EqualIgnoringConst(toArrayType->GetBaseType(),
06599                                         fromArrayType->GetBaseType()));
06600         llvm::Value *v = expr->GetValue(ctx);
06601         llvm::Type *ptype = toType->LLVMType(g->ctx);
06602         return ctx->BitCastInst(v, ptype); //, "array_cast_0size");
06603     }
06604 
06605     const ReferenceType *toReference = CastType<ReferenceType>(toType);
06606     const ReferenceType *fromReference = CastType<ReferenceType>(fromType);
06607     if (toReference && fromReference) {
06608         const Type *toTarget = toReference->GetReferenceTarget();
06609         const Type *fromTarget = fromReference->GetReferenceTarget();
06610 
06611         const ArrayType *toArray = CastType<ArrayType>(toTarget);
06612         const ArrayType *fromArray = CastType<ArrayType>(fromTarget);
06613         if (toArray && fromArray) {
06614             // cast array pointer from [n x foo] to [0 x foo] if needed to be able
06615             // to pass to a function that takes an unsized array as a parameter
06616             if(toArray->GetElementCount() != 0 && 
06617                (toArray->GetElementCount() != fromArray->GetElementCount()))
06618                 Warning(pos, "Type-converting array of length %d to length %d",
06619                         fromArray->GetElementCount(), toArray->GetElementCount());
06620             AssertPos(pos, Type::EqualIgnoringConst(toArray->GetBaseType(),
06621                                             fromArray->GetBaseType()));
06622             llvm::Value *v = expr->GetValue(ctx);
06623             llvm::Type *ptype = toType->LLVMType(g->ctx);
06624             return ctx->BitCastInst(v, ptype); //, "array_cast_0size");
06625         }
06626 
06627         AssertPos(pos, Type::Equal(toTarget, fromTarget) ||
06628                Type::Equal(toTarget, fromTarget->GetAsConstType()));
06629         return expr->GetValue(ctx);
06630     }
06631 
06632     const StructType *toStruct = CastType<StructType>(toType);
06633     const StructType *fromStruct = CastType<StructType>(fromType);
06634     if (toStruct && fromStruct) {
06635         // The only legal type conversions for structs are to go from a
06636         // uniform to a varying instance of the same struct type.
06637         AssertPos(pos, toStruct->IsVaryingType() && fromStruct->IsUniformType() &&
06638                Type::EqualIgnoringConst(toStruct, 
06639                                         fromStruct->GetAsVaryingType()));
06640 
06641         llvm::Value *origValue = expr->GetValue(ctx);
06642         if (!origValue)
06643             return NULL;
06644         return lUniformValueToVarying(ctx, origValue, fromType);
06645     }
06646 
06647     const VectorType *toVector = CastType<VectorType>(toType);
06648     const VectorType *fromVector = CastType<VectorType>(fromType);
06649     if (toVector && fromVector) {
06650         // this should be caught during typechecking
06651         AssertPos(pos, toVector->GetElementCount() == fromVector->GetElementCount());
06652 
06653         llvm::Value *exprVal = expr->GetValue(ctx);
06654         if (!exprVal)
06655             return NULL;
06656 
06657         // Emit instructions to do type conversion of each of the elements
06658         // of the vector.
06659         // FIXME: since uniform vectors are represented as
06660         // llvm::VectorTypes, we should just be able to issue the
06661         // corresponding vector type convert, which should be more
06662         // efficient by avoiding serialization!
06663         llvm::Value *cast = llvm::UndefValue::get(toType->LLVMType(g->ctx));
06664         for (int i = 0; i < toVector->GetElementCount(); ++i) {
06665             llvm::Value *ei = ctx->ExtractInst(exprVal, i);
06666 
06667             llvm::Value *conv = lTypeConvAtomic(ctx, ei, toVector->GetElementType(),
06668                                                 fromVector->GetElementType(), pos);
06669             if (!conv) 
06670                 return NULL;
06671             cast = ctx->InsertInst(cast, conv, i);
06672         }
06673         return cast;
06674     }
06675 
06676     llvm::Value *exprVal = expr->GetValue(ctx);
06677     if (!exprVal)
06678         return NULL;
06679 
06680     const EnumType *fromEnum = CastType<EnumType>(fromType);
06681     const EnumType *toEnum = CastType<EnumType>(toType);
06682     if (fromEnum)
06683         // treat it as an uint32 type for the below and all will be good.
06684         fromType = fromEnum->IsUniformType() ? AtomicType::UniformUInt32 :
06685             AtomicType::VaryingUInt32;
06686     if (toEnum)
06687         // treat it as an uint32 type for the below and all will be good.
06688         toType = toEnum->IsUniformType() ? AtomicType::UniformUInt32 :
06689             AtomicType::VaryingUInt32;
06690 
06691     const AtomicType *fromAtomic = CastType<AtomicType>(fromType);
06692     // at this point, coming from an atomic type is all that's left...
06693     AssertPos(pos, fromAtomic != NULL);
06694 
06695     if (toVector) {
06696         // scalar -> short vector conversion
06697         llvm::Value *conv = lTypeConvAtomic(ctx, exprVal, toVector->GetElementType(),
06698                                             fromAtomic, pos);
06699         if (!conv) 
06700             return NULL;
06701 
06702         llvm::Value *cast = llvm::UndefValue::get(toType->LLVMType(g->ctx));
06703         for (int i = 0; i < toVector->GetElementCount(); ++i)
06704             cast = ctx->InsertInst(cast, conv, i);
06705         return cast;
06706     }
06707     else if (toPointerType != NULL) {
06708         // int -> ptr
06709         if (toType->IsVaryingType() && fromType->IsUniformType())
06710             exprVal = ctx->SmearUniform(exprVal);
06711 
06712         llvm::Type *llvmToType = toType->LLVMType(g->ctx);
06713         if (llvmToType == NULL)
06714             return NULL;
06715 
06716         return ctx->IntToPtrInst(exprVal, llvmToType, "int_to_ptr");
06717     }
06718     else {
06719         const AtomicType *toAtomic = CastType<AtomicType>(toType);
06720         // typechecking should ensure this is the case
06721         AssertPos(pos, toAtomic != NULL);
06722 
06723         return lTypeConvAtomic(ctx, exprVal, toAtomic, fromAtomic, pos);
06724     }
06725 }
06726 
06727 
06728 const Type *
06729 TypeCastExpr::GetType() const { 
06730     AssertPos(pos, type->HasUnboundVariability() == false);
06731     return type; 
06732 }
06733 
06734 
06735 static const Type *
06736 lDeconstifyType(const Type *t) {
06737     const PointerType *pt = CastType<PointerType>(t);
06738     if (pt != NULL)
06739         return new PointerType(lDeconstifyType(pt->GetBaseType()), 
06740                                pt->GetVariability(), false);
06741     else
06742         return t->GetAsNonConstType();
06743 }
06744 
06745 
06746 Expr *
06747 TypeCastExpr::TypeCheck() {
06748     if (expr == NULL)
06749         return NULL;
06750 
06751     const Type *toType = type, *fromType = expr->GetType();
06752     if (toType == NULL || fromType == NULL)
06753         return NULL;
06754 
06755     if (toType->HasUnboundVariability() && fromType->IsUniformType()) {
06756         TypeCastExpr *tce = new TypeCastExpr(toType->GetAsUniformType(),
06757                                              expr, pos);
06758         return ::TypeCheck(tce);
06759     }
06760     type = toType = type->ResolveUnboundVariability(Variability::Varying);
06761 
06762     fromType = lDeconstifyType(fromType);
06763     toType = lDeconstifyType(toType);
06764 
06765     // Anything can be cast to void...
06766     if (Type::Equal(toType, AtomicType::Void))
06767         return this;
06768 
06769     if (Type::Equal(fromType, AtomicType::Void) ||
06770         (fromType->IsVaryingType() && toType->IsUniformType())) {
06771         Error(pos, "Can't type cast from type \"%s\" to type \"%s\"",
06772               fromType->GetString().c_str(), toType->GetString().c_str());
06773         return NULL;
06774     }
06775 
06776     // First some special cases that we allow only with an explicit type cast
06777     const PointerType *fromPtr = CastType<PointerType>(fromType);
06778     const PointerType *toPtr = CastType<PointerType>(toType);
06779     if (fromPtr != NULL && toPtr != NULL)
06780         // allow explicit typecasts between any two different pointer types
06781         return this;
06782 
06783     const AtomicType *fromAtomic = CastType<AtomicType>(fromType);
06784     const AtomicType *toAtomic = CastType<AtomicType>(toType);
06785     const EnumType *fromEnum = CastType<EnumType>(fromType);
06786     const EnumType *toEnum = CastType<EnumType>(toType);
06787     if ((fromAtomic || fromEnum) && (toAtomic || toEnum))
06788         // Allow explicit casts between all of these
06789         return this;
06790 
06791     // ptr -> int type casts
06792     if (fromPtr != NULL && toAtomic != NULL && toAtomic->IsIntType()) {
06793         bool safeCast = (toAtomic->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_INT64 ||
06794                          toAtomic->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64);
06795         if (g->target.is32Bit)
06796             safeCast |= (toAtomic->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_INT32 ||
06797                          toAtomic->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32);
06798         if (safeCast == false)
06799             Warning(pos, "Pointer type cast of type \"%s\" to integer type "
06800                     "\"%s\" may lose information.", 
06801                     fromType->GetString().c_str(), 
06802                     toType->GetString().c_str());
06803         return this;
06804     }
06805 
06806     // int -> ptr
06807     if (fromAtomic != NULL && fromAtomic->IsIntType() && toPtr != NULL)
06808         return this;
06809 
06810     // And otherwise see if it's one of the conversions allowed to happen
06811     // implicitly.
06812     if (CanConvertTypes(fromType, toType, "type cast expression", pos) == false)
06813         return NULL;
06814 
06815     return this;
06816 }
06817 
06818 
06819 Expr *
06820 TypeCastExpr::Optimize() {
06821     ConstExpr *constExpr = dynamic_cast<ConstExpr *>(expr);
06822     if (constExpr == NULL)
06823         // We can't do anything if this isn't a const expr
06824         return this;
06825 
06826     const Type *toType = GetType();
06827     const AtomicType *toAtomic = CastType<AtomicType>(toType);
06828     const EnumType *toEnum = CastType<EnumType>(toType);
06829     // If we're not casting to an atomic or enum type, we can't do anything
06830     // here, since ConstExprs can only represent those two types.  (So
06831     // e.g. we're casting from an int to an int<4>.)
06832     if (toAtomic == NULL && toEnum == NULL)
06833         return this;
06834 
06835     bool forceVarying = toType->IsVaryingType();
06836 
06837     // All of the type conversion smarts we need is already in the
06838     // ConstExpr::AsBool(), etc., methods, so we just need to call the
06839     // appropriate one for the type that this cast is converting to.
06840     AtomicType::BasicType basicType = toAtomic ? toAtomic->basicType :
06841         AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32;
06842     switch (basicType) {
06843     case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL: {
06844         bool bv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
06845         constExpr->AsBool(bv, forceVarying);
06846         return new ConstExpr(toType, bv, pos);
06847     }
06848     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8: {
06849         int8_t iv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
06850         constExpr->AsInt8(iv, forceVarying);
06851         return new ConstExpr(toType, iv, pos);
06852     }
06853     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8: {
06854         uint8_t uv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
06855         constExpr->AsUInt8(uv, forceVarying);
06856         return new ConstExpr(toType, uv, pos);
06857     }
06858     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16: {
06859         int16_t iv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
06860         constExpr->AsInt16(iv, forceVarying);
06861         return new ConstExpr(toType, iv, pos);
06862     }
06863     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16: {
06864         uint16_t uv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
06865         constExpr->AsUInt16(uv, forceVarying);
06866         return new ConstExpr(toType, uv, pos);
06867     }
06868     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32: {
06869         int32_t iv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
06870         constExpr->AsInt32(iv, forceVarying);
06871         return new ConstExpr(toType, iv, pos);
06872     }
06873     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32: {
06874         uint32_t uv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
06875         constExpr->AsUInt32(uv, forceVarying);
06876         return new ConstExpr(toType, uv, pos);
06877     }
06878     case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT: {
06879         float fv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
06880         constExpr->AsFloat(fv, forceVarying);
06881         return new ConstExpr(toType, fv, pos);
06882     }
06883     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64: {
06884         int64_t iv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
06885         constExpr->AsInt64(iv, forceVarying);
06886         return new ConstExpr(toType, iv, pos);
06887     }
06888     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64: {
06889         uint64_t uv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
06890         constExpr->AsUInt64(uv, forceVarying);
06891         return new ConstExpr(toType, uv, pos);
06892     }
06893     case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE: {
06894         double dv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
06895         constExpr->AsDouble(dv, forceVarying);
06896         return new ConstExpr(toType, dv, pos);
06897     }
06898     default:
06899         FATAL("unimplemented");
06900     }
06901     return this;
06902 }
06903 
06904 
06905 int
06906 TypeCastExpr::EstimateCost() const {
06907     if (dynamic_cast<ConstExpr *>(expr) != NULL)
06908         return 0;
06909 
06910     // FIXME: return COST_TYPECAST_COMPLEX when appropriate
06911     return COST_TYPECAST_SIMPLE;
06912 }
06913 
06914 
06915 void
06916 TypeCastExpr::Print() const {
06917     printf("[%s] type cast (", GetType()->GetString().c_str());
06918     expr->Print();
06919     printf(")");
06920     pos.Print();
06921 }
06922 
06923 
06924 Symbol *
06925 TypeCastExpr::GetBaseSymbol() const {
06926     return expr ? expr->GetBaseSymbol() : NULL;
06927 }
06928 
06929 
06930 static
06931 llvm::Constant *
06932 lConvertPointerConstant(llvm::Constant *c, const Type *constType) {
06933     if (c == NULL || constType->IsUniformType())
06934         return c;
06935 
06936     // Handle conversion to int and then to vector of int or array of int
06937     // (for varying and soa types, respectively)
06938     llvm::Constant *intPtr = 
06939         llvm::ConstantExpr::getPtrToInt(c, LLVMTypes::PointerIntType);
06940     Assert(constType->IsVaryingType() || constType->IsSOAType());
06941     int count = constType->IsVaryingType() ? g->target.vectorWidth :
06942         constType->GetSOAWidth();
06943 
06944     std::vector<llvm::Constant *> smear;
06945     for (int i = 0; i < count; ++i)
06946         smear.push_back(intPtr);
06947 
06948     if (constType->IsVaryingType())
06949         return llvm::ConstantVector::get(smear);
06950     else {
06951         llvm::ArrayType *at =
06952             llvm::ArrayType::get(LLVMTypes::PointerIntType, count);
06953         return llvm::ConstantArray::get(at, smear);
06954     }
06955 }
06956 
06957 
06958 llvm::Constant *
06959 TypeCastExpr::GetConstant(const Type *constType) const {
06960     // We don't need to worry about most the basic cases where the type
06961     // cast can resolve to a constant here, since the
06962     // TypeCastExpr::Optimize() method generally ends up doing the type
06963     // conversion and returning a ConstExpr, which in turn will have its
06964     // GetConstant() method called.  However, because ConstExpr currently
06965     // can't represent pointer values, we have to handle a few cases
06966     // related to pointers here:
06967     //
06968     // 1. Null pointer (NULL, 0) valued initializers
06969     // 2. Converting function types to pointer-to-function types
06970     // 3. And converting these from uniform to the varying/soa equivalents.
06971     //
06972     if (CastType<PointerType>(constType) == NULL)
06973         return NULL;
06974 
06975     llvm::Constant *c = expr->GetConstant(constType->GetAsUniformType());
06976     return lConvertPointerConstant(c, constType);
06977 }
06978 
06979 
06980 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
06981 // ReferenceExpr
06982 
06983 ReferenceExpr::ReferenceExpr(Expr *e, SourcePos p)
06984     : Expr(p) {
06985     expr = e;
06986 }
06987 
06988 
06989 llvm::Value *
06990 ReferenceExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
06991     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
06992     if (expr == NULL) {
06993         AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
06994         return NULL;
06995     }
06996     
06997     llvm::Value *value = expr->GetLValue(ctx);
06998     if (value != NULL)
06999         return value;
07000 
07001     // value is NULL if the expression is a temporary; in this case, we'll
07002     // allocate storage for it so that we can return the pointer to that...
07003     const Type *type;
07004     llvm::Type *llvmType;
07005     if ((type = expr->GetType()) == NULL ||
07006         (llvmType = type->LLVMType(g->ctx)) == NULL) {
07007         AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
07008         return NULL;
07009     }
07010 
07011     value = expr->GetValue(ctx);
07012     if (value == NULL) {
07013         AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
07014         return NULL;
07015     }
07016 
07017     llvm::Value *ptr = ctx->AllocaInst(llvmType);
07018     ctx->StoreInst(value, ptr);
07019     return ptr;
07020 }
07021 
07022 
07023 Symbol *
07024 ReferenceExpr::GetBaseSymbol() const {
07025     return expr ? expr->GetBaseSymbol() : NULL;
07026 }
07027 
07028 
07029 const Type *
07030 ReferenceExpr::GetType() const {
07031     if (!expr) 
07032         return NULL;
07033 
07034     const Type *type = expr->GetType();
07035     if (!type) 
07036         return NULL;
07037 
07038     return new ReferenceType(type);
07039 }
07040 
07041 
07042 const Type *
07043 ReferenceExpr::GetLValueType() const {
07044     if (!expr) 
07045         return NULL;
07046 
07047     const Type *type = expr->GetType();
07048     if (!type) 
07049         return NULL;
07050 
07051     return PointerType::GetUniform(type);
07052 }
07053 
07054 
07055 Expr *
07056 ReferenceExpr::Optimize() {
07057     if (expr == NULL)
07058         return NULL;
07059     return this;
07060 }
07061 
07062 
07063 Expr *
07064 ReferenceExpr::TypeCheck() {
07065     if (expr == NULL)
07066         return NULL;
07067     return this;
07068 }
07069 
07070 
07071 int
07072 ReferenceExpr::EstimateCost() const {
07073     return 0;
07074 }
07075 
07076 
07077 void
07078 ReferenceExpr::Print() const {
07079     if (expr == NULL || GetType() == NULL)
07080         return;
07081 
07082     printf("[%s] &(", GetType()->GetString().c_str());
07083     expr->Print();
07084     printf(")");
07085     pos.Print();
07086 }
07087 
07088 
07089 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
07090 // DerefExpr
07091 
07092 DerefExpr::DerefExpr(Expr *e, SourcePos p)
07093     : Expr(p) {
07094     expr = e;
07095 }
07096 
07097 
07098 llvm::Value *
07099 DerefExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
07100     if (expr == NULL) 
07101         return NULL;
07102     llvm::Value *ptr = expr->GetValue(ctx);
07103     if (ptr == NULL)
07104         return NULL;
07105     const Type *type = expr->GetType();
07106     if (type == NULL)
07107         return NULL;
07108 
07109     if (lVaryingStructHasUniformMember(type, pos))
07110         return NULL;
07111 
07112     Symbol *baseSym = expr->GetBaseSymbol();
07113     llvm::Value *mask = baseSym ? lMaskForSymbol(baseSym, ctx) : 
07114         ctx->GetFullMask();
07115 
07116     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
07117     return ctx->LoadInst(ptr, mask, type);
07118 }
07119 
07120 
07121 llvm::Value *
07122 DerefExpr::GetLValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
07123     if (expr == NULL) 
07124         return NULL;
07125     return expr->GetValue(ctx);
07126 }
07127 
07128 
07129 const Type *
07130 DerefExpr::GetLValueType() const {
07131     if (expr == NULL)
07132         return NULL;
07133     return expr->GetType();
07134 }
07135 
07136 
07137 Symbol *
07138 DerefExpr::GetBaseSymbol() const {
07139     return expr ? expr->GetBaseSymbol() : NULL;
07140 }
07141 
07142 
07143 Expr *
07144 DerefExpr::Optimize() {
07145     if (expr == NULL)
07146         return NULL;
07147     return this;
07148 }
07149 
07150 
07151 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
07152 // PtrDerefExpr
07153 
07154 PtrDerefExpr::PtrDerefExpr(Expr *e, SourcePos p)
07155     : DerefExpr(e, p) {
07156 }
07157 
07158 
07159 const Type *
07160 PtrDerefExpr::GetType() const {
07161     const Type *type;
07162     if (expr == NULL || (type = expr->GetType()) == NULL) {
07163         AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
07164         return NULL;
07165     }
07166     AssertPos(pos, CastType<PointerType>(type) != NULL);
07167 
07168     if (type->IsUniformType())
07169         return type->GetBaseType();
07170     else
07171         return type->GetBaseType()->GetAsVaryingType();
07172 }
07173 
07174 
07175 Expr *
07176 PtrDerefExpr::TypeCheck() {
07177     const Type *type;
07178     if (expr == NULL || (type = expr->GetType()) == NULL) {
07179         AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
07180         return NULL;
07181     }
07182 
07183     if (const PointerType *pt = CastType<PointerType>(type)) {
07184         if (Type::Equal(AtomicType::Void, pt->GetBaseType())) {
07185             Error(pos, "Illegal to dereference void pointer type \"%s\".",
07186                   type->GetString().c_str());
07187             return NULL;
07188         }
07189     }
07190     else {
07191         Error(pos, "Illegal to dereference non-pointer type \"%s\".", 
07192               type->GetString().c_str());
07193         return NULL;
07194     }
07195 
07196     return this;
07197 }
07198 
07199 
07200 int
07201 PtrDerefExpr::EstimateCost() const {
07202     const Type *type;
07203     if (expr == NULL || (type = expr->GetType()) == NULL) {
07204         AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
07205         return 0;
07206     }
07207 
07208     if (type->IsVaryingType())
07209         // Be pessimistic; some of these will later be optimized into
07210         // vector loads/stores..
07211         return COST_GATHER + COST_DEREF;
07212     else
07213         return COST_DEREF;
07214 }
07215 
07216 
07217 void
07218 PtrDerefExpr::Print() const {
07219     if (expr == NULL || GetType() == NULL)
07220         return;
07221 
07222     printf("[%s] *(", GetType()->GetString().c_str());
07223     expr->Print();
07224     printf(")");
07225     pos.Print();
07226 }
07227 
07228 
07229 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
07230 // RefDerefExpr
07231 
07232 RefDerefExpr::RefDerefExpr(Expr *e, SourcePos p)
07233     : DerefExpr(e, p) {
07234 }
07235 
07236 
07237 const Type *
07238 RefDerefExpr::GetType() const {
07239     const Type *type;
07240     if (expr == NULL || (type = expr->GetType()) == NULL) {
07241         AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
07242         return NULL;
07243     }
07244         
07245     AssertPos(pos, CastType<ReferenceType>(type) != NULL);
07246     return type->GetReferenceTarget();
07247 }
07248 
07249 
07250 Expr *
07251 RefDerefExpr::TypeCheck() {
07252     const Type *type;
07253     if (expr == NULL || (type = expr->GetType()) == NULL) {
07254         AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
07255         return NULL;
07256     }
07257 
07258     // We only create RefDerefExprs internally for references in
07259     // expressions, so we should never create one with a non-reference
07260     // expression...
07261     AssertPos(pos, CastType<ReferenceType>(type) != NULL);
07262 
07263     return this;
07264 }
07265 
07266 
07267 int
07268 RefDerefExpr::EstimateCost() const {
07269     if (expr == NULL)
07270         return 0;
07271 
07272     return COST_DEREF;
07273 }
07274 
07275 
07276 void
07277 RefDerefExpr::Print() const {
07278     if (expr == NULL || GetType() == NULL)
07279         return;
07280 
07281     printf("[%s] deref-reference (", GetType()->GetString().c_str());
07282     expr->Print();
07283     printf(")");
07284     pos.Print();
07285 }
07286 
07287 
07288 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
07289 // AddressOfExpr
07290 
07291 AddressOfExpr::AddressOfExpr(Expr *e, SourcePos p)
07292     : Expr(p), expr(e) {
07293 }
07294 
07295 
07296 llvm::Value *
07297 AddressOfExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
07298     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
07299     if (expr == NULL)
07300         return NULL;
07301 
07302     const Type *exprType = expr->GetType();
07303     if (CastType<ReferenceType>(exprType) != NULL ||
07304         CastType<FunctionType>(exprType) != NULL)
07305         return expr->GetValue(ctx);
07306     else
07307         return expr->GetLValue(ctx);
07308 }
07309 
07310 
07311 const Type *
07312 AddressOfExpr::GetType() const {
07313     if (expr == NULL)
07314         return NULL;
07315 
07316     const Type *exprType = expr->GetType();
07317     if (CastType<ReferenceType>(exprType) != NULL)
07318         return PointerType::GetUniform(exprType->GetReferenceTarget());
07319 
07320     const Type *t = expr->GetLValueType();
07321     if (t != NULL)
07322         return t;
07323     else {
07324         t = expr->GetType();
07325         if (t == NULL) {
07326             AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
07327             return NULL;
07328         }
07329         return PointerType::GetUniform(t);
07330     }
07331 }
07332 
07333 
07334 Symbol *
07335 AddressOfExpr::GetBaseSymbol() const {
07336     return expr ? expr->GetBaseSymbol() : NULL;
07337 }
07338 
07339 
07340 void
07341 AddressOfExpr::Print() const {
07342     printf("&(");
07343     if (expr)
07344         expr->Print();
07345     else
07346         printf("NULL expr");
07347     printf(")");
07348     pos.Print();
07349 }
07350 
07351 
07352 Expr *
07353 AddressOfExpr::TypeCheck() {
07354     const Type *exprType;
07355     if (expr == NULL || (exprType = expr->GetType()) == NULL) {
07356         AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
07357         return NULL;
07358     }
07359 
07360     if (CastType<ReferenceType>(exprType) != NULL ||
07361         CastType<FunctionType>(exprType) != NULL) {
07362         return this;
07363     }
07364 
07365     if (expr->GetLValueType() != NULL)
07366         return this;
07367 
07368     Error(expr->pos, "Illegal to take address of non-lvalue or function.");
07369     return NULL;
07370 }
07371 
07372 
07373 Expr *
07374 AddressOfExpr::Optimize() {
07375     return this;
07376 }
07377 
07378 
07379 int
07380 AddressOfExpr::EstimateCost() const {
07381     return 0;
07382 }
07383 
07384 
07385 llvm::Constant *
07386 AddressOfExpr::GetConstant(const Type *type) const {
07387     const Type *exprType;
07388     if (expr == NULL || (exprType = expr->GetType()) == NULL) {
07389         AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
07390         return NULL;
07391     }
07392 
07393     const PointerType *pt = CastType<PointerType>(type);
07394     if (pt == NULL)
07395         return NULL;
07396 
07397     const FunctionType *ft = CastType<FunctionType>(pt->GetBaseType());
07398     if (ft != NULL) {
07399         llvm::Constant *c = expr->GetConstant(ft);
07400         return lConvertPointerConstant(c, type);
07401     }
07402     else
07403         return NULL;
07404 }
07405 
07406 
07407 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
07408 // SizeOfExpr
07409 
07410 SizeOfExpr::SizeOfExpr(Expr *e, SourcePos p) 
07411     : Expr(p), expr(e), type(NULL) {
07412 }
07413 
07414 
07415 SizeOfExpr::SizeOfExpr(const Type *t, SourcePos p)
07416     : Expr(p), expr(NULL), type(t) {
07417     type = type->ResolveUnboundVariability(Variability::Varying);
07418 }
07419 
07420 
07421 llvm::Value *
07422 SizeOfExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
07423     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
07424     const Type *t = expr ? expr->GetType() : type;
07425     if (t == NULL)
07426         return NULL;
07427 
07428     llvm::Type *llvmType = t->LLVMType(g->ctx);
07429     if (llvmType == NULL)
07430         return NULL;
07431 
07432     return g->target.SizeOf(llvmType, ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock());
07433 }
07434 
07435 
07436 const Type *
07437 SizeOfExpr::GetType() const {
07438     return (g->target.is32Bit || g->opt.force32BitAddressing) ? 
07439         AtomicType::UniformUInt32 : AtomicType::UniformUInt64;
07440 }
07441 
07442 
07443 void
07444 SizeOfExpr::Print() const {
07445     printf("Sizeof (");
07446     if (expr != NULL) 
07447         expr->Print();
07448     const Type *t = expr ? expr->GetType() : type;
07449     if (t != NULL)
07450         printf(" [type %s]", t->GetString().c_str());
07451     printf(")");
07452     pos.Print();
07453 }
07454 
07455 
07456 Expr *
07457 SizeOfExpr::TypeCheck() {
07458     // Can't compute the size of a struct without a definition
07459     if (type != NULL &&
07460         CastType<UndefinedStructType>(type) != NULL) {
07461         Error(pos, "Can't compute the size of declared but not defined "
07462               "struct type \"%s\".", type->GetString().c_str());
07463         return NULL;
07464     }
07465 
07466     return this;
07467 }
07468 
07469 
07470 Expr *
07471 SizeOfExpr::Optimize() {
07472     return this;
07473 }
07474 
07475 
07476 int
07477 SizeOfExpr::EstimateCost() const {
07478     return 0;
07479 }
07480 
07481 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
07482 // SymbolExpr
07483 
07484 SymbolExpr::SymbolExpr(Symbol *s, SourcePos p) 
07485   : Expr(p) {
07486     symbol = s;
07487 }
07488 
07489 
07490 llvm::Value *
07491 SymbolExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
07492     // storagePtr may be NULL due to an earlier compilation error
07493     if (!symbol || !symbol->storagePtr)
07494         return NULL;
07495     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
07496 
07497     std::string loadName = symbol->name + std::string("_load");
07498     return ctx->LoadInst(symbol->storagePtr, loadName.c_str());
07499 }
07500 
07501 
07502 llvm::Value *
07503 SymbolExpr::GetLValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
07504     if (symbol == NULL)
07505         return NULL;
07506     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
07507     return symbol->storagePtr;
07508 }
07509 
07510 
07511 const Type *
07512 SymbolExpr::GetLValueType() const {
07513     if (symbol == NULL)
07514         return NULL;
07515 
07516     if (CastType<ReferenceType>(symbol->type) != NULL)
07517         return PointerType::GetUniform(symbol->type->GetReferenceTarget());
07518     else
07519         return PointerType::GetUniform(symbol->type);
07520 }
07521 
07522 
07523 Symbol *
07524 SymbolExpr::GetBaseSymbol() const {
07525     return symbol;
07526 }
07527 
07528 
07529 const Type *
07530 SymbolExpr::GetType() const { 
07531     return symbol ? symbol->type : NULL;
07532 }
07533 
07534 
07535 Expr *
07536 SymbolExpr::TypeCheck() {
07537     return this;
07538 }
07539 
07540 
07541 Expr *
07542 SymbolExpr::Optimize() {
07543     if (symbol == NULL)
07544         return NULL;
07545     else if (symbol->constValue != NULL) {
07546         AssertPos(pos, GetType()->IsConstType());
07547         return new ConstExpr(symbol->constValue, pos);
07548     }
07549     else
07550         return this;
07551 }
07552 
07553 
07554 int
07555 SymbolExpr::EstimateCost() const {
07556     // Be optimistic and assume it's in a register or can be used as a
07557     // memory operand..
07558     return 0;
07559 }
07560 
07561 
07562 void
07563 SymbolExpr::Print() const {
07564     if (symbol == NULL || GetType() == NULL)
07565         return;
07566 
07567     printf("[%s] sym: (%s)", GetType()->GetString().c_str(), 
07568            symbol->name.c_str());
07569     pos.Print();
07570 }
07571 
07572 
07573 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
07574 // FunctionSymbolExpr
07575 
07576 FunctionSymbolExpr::FunctionSymbolExpr(const char *n,
07577                                        const std::vector<Symbol *> &candidates,
07578                                        SourcePos p) 
07579   : Expr(p) {
07580     name = n;
07581     candidateFunctions = candidates;
07582     matchingFunc = (candidates.size() == 1) ? candidates[0] : NULL;
07583     triedToResolve = false;
07584 }
07585 
07586 
07587 const Type *
07588 FunctionSymbolExpr::GetType() const {
07589     if (triedToResolve == false && matchingFunc == NULL) {
07590         Error(pos, "Ambiguous use of overloaded function \"%s\".", 
07591               name.c_str());
07592         return NULL;
07593     }
07594 
07595     return matchingFunc ? matchingFunc->type : NULL;
07596 }
07597 
07598 
07599 llvm::Value *
07600 FunctionSymbolExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
07601     return matchingFunc ? matchingFunc->function : NULL;
07602 }
07603 
07604 
07605 Symbol *
07606 FunctionSymbolExpr::GetBaseSymbol() const {
07607     return matchingFunc;
07608 }
07609 
07610 
07611 Expr *
07612 FunctionSymbolExpr::TypeCheck() {
07613     return this;
07614 }
07615 
07616 
07617 Expr *
07618 FunctionSymbolExpr::Optimize() {
07619     return this;
07620 }
07621 
07622 
07623 int
07624 FunctionSymbolExpr::EstimateCost() const {
07625     return 0;
07626 }
07627 
07628 
07629 void
07630 FunctionSymbolExpr::Print() const {
07631     if (!matchingFunc || !GetType())
07632         return;
07633 
07634     printf("[%s] fun sym (%s)", GetType()->GetString().c_str(),
07635            matchingFunc->name.c_str());
07636     pos.Print();
07637 }
07638 
07639 
07640 llvm::Constant *
07641 FunctionSymbolExpr::GetConstant(const Type *type) const {
07642     if (matchingFunc == NULL || matchingFunc->function == NULL)
07643         return NULL;
07644 
07645     const FunctionType *ft = CastType<FunctionType>(type);
07646     if (ft == NULL)
07647         return NULL;
07648 
07649     if (Type::Equal(type, matchingFunc->type) == false) {
07650         Error(pos, "Type of function symbol \"%s\" doesn't match expected type "
07651               "\"%s\".", matchingFunc->type->GetString().c_str(),
07652               type->GetString().c_str());
07653         return NULL;
07654     }
07655 
07656     return matchingFunc->function;
07657 }
07658 
07659 
07660 static void
07661 lPrintOverloadCandidates(SourcePos pos, const std::vector<Symbol *> &funcs, 
07662                          const std::vector<const Type *> &argTypes, 
07663                          const std::vector<bool> *argCouldBeNULL) {
07664     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < funcs.size(); ++i) {
07665         const FunctionType *ft = CastType<FunctionType>(funcs[i]->type);
07666         AssertPos(pos, ft != NULL);
07667         Error(funcs[i]->pos, "Candidate function: %s.", ft->GetString().c_str());
07668     }
07669 
07670     std::string passedTypes = "Passed types: (";
07671     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < argTypes.size(); ++i) {
07672         if (argTypes[i] != NULL)
07673             passedTypes += argTypes[i]->GetString();
07674         else
07675             passedTypes += "(unknown type)";
07676         passedTypes += (i < argTypes.size()-1) ? ", " : ")\n\n";
07677     }
07678     Error(pos, "%s", passedTypes.c_str());
07679 }
07680 
07681 
07682 static bool
07683 lIsMatchToNonConstReference(const Type *callType, const Type *funcArgType) {
07684     return (CastType<ReferenceType>(funcArgType) &&
07685             (funcArgType->IsConstType() == false) &&
07686             Type::Equal(callType, funcArgType->GetReferenceTarget()));
07687 }
07688 
07689 
07690 static bool
07691 lIsMatchToNonConstReferenceUnifToVarying(const Type *callType,
07692                                          const Type *funcArgType) {
07693     return (CastType<ReferenceType>(funcArgType) &&
07694             (funcArgType->IsConstType() == false) &&
07695             Type::Equal(callType->GetAsVaryingType(),
07696                         funcArgType->GetReferenceTarget()));
07697 }
07698 
07699 /** Helper function used for function overload resolution: returns true if
07700     converting the argument to the call type only requires a type
07701     conversion that won't lose information.  Otherwise return false.
07702   */
07703 static bool
07704 lIsMatchWithTypeWidening(const Type *callType, const Type *funcArgType) {
07705     const AtomicType *callAt = CastType<AtomicType>(callType);
07706     const AtomicType *funcAt = CastType<AtomicType>(funcArgType);
07707     if (callAt == NULL || funcAt == NULL)
07708         return false;
07709 
07710     if (callAt->IsUniformType() != funcAt->IsUniformType())
07711         return false;
07712 
07713     switch (callAt->basicType) {
07714     case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
07715         return true;
07716     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
07717     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
07718         return (funcAt->basicType != AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL);
07719     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
07720     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
07721         return (funcAt->basicType != AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL &&
07722                 funcAt->basicType != AtomicType::TYPE_INT8 &&
07723                 funcAt->basicType != AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8);
07724     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
07725     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
07726         return (funcAt->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_INT32 ||
07727                 funcAt->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32 ||
07728                 funcAt->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_INT64 ||
07729                 funcAt->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64);
07730     case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
07731         return (funcAt->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE);
07732     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
07733     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
07734         return (funcAt->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_INT64 ||
07735                 funcAt->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64);
07736     case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
07737         return false;
07738     default:
07739         FATAL("Unhandled atomic type");
07740         return false;
07741     }
07742 }
07743 
07744 
07745 /** Helper function used for function overload resolution: returns true if
07746     the call argument type and the function argument type match if we only
07747     do a uniform -> varying type conversion but otherwise have exactly the
07748     same type.
07749  */
07750 static bool
07751 lIsMatchWithUniformToVarying(const Type *callType, const Type *funcArgType) {
07752     return (callType->IsUniformType() && 
07753             funcArgType->IsVaryingType() &&
07754             Type::EqualIgnoringConst(callType->GetAsVaryingType(), funcArgType));
07755 }
07756 
07757 
07758 /** Helper function used for function overload resolution: returns true if
07759     we can type convert from the call argument type to the function
07760     argument type, but without doing a uniform -> varying conversion.
07761  */
07762 static bool
07763 lIsMatchWithTypeConvSameVariability(const Type *callType,
07764                                     const Type *funcArgType) {
07765     return (CanConvertTypes(callType, funcArgType) &&
07766             (callType->GetVariability() == funcArgType->GetVariability()));
07767 }
07768 
07769 
07770 /* Returns the set of function overloads that are potential matches, given
07771    argCount values being passed as arguments to the function call.
07772  */
07773 std::vector<Symbol *>
07774 FunctionSymbolExpr::getCandidateFunctions(int argCount) const {
07775     std::vector<Symbol *> ret;
07776     for (int i = 0; i < (int)candidateFunctions.size(); ++i) {
07777         const FunctionType *ft = 
07778             CastType<FunctionType>(candidateFunctions[i]->type);
07779         AssertPos(pos, ft != NULL);
07780 
07781         // There's no way to match if the caller is passing more arguments
07782         // than this function instance takes.
07783         if (argCount > ft->GetNumParameters())
07784             continue;
07785 
07786         // Not enough arguments, and no default argument value to save us
07787         if (argCount < ft->GetNumParameters() &&
07788             ft->GetParameterDefault(argCount) == NULL)
07789             continue;
07790 
07791         // Success
07792         ret.push_back(candidateFunctions[i]);
07793     }
07794     return ret;
07795 }
07796 
07797 
07798 static bool
07799 lArgIsPointerType(const Type *type) {
07800     if (CastType<PointerType>(type) != NULL)
07801         return true;
07802 
07803     const ReferenceType *rt = CastType<ReferenceType>(type);
07804     if (rt == NULL)
07805         return false;
07806 
07807     const Type *t = rt->GetReferenceTarget();
07808     return (CastType<PointerType>(t) != NULL);
07809 }
07810 
07811 
07812 /** This function computes the value of a cost function that represents the
07813     cost of calling a function of the given type with arguments of the
07814     given types.  If it's not possible to call the function, regardless of
07815     any type conversions applied, a cost of -1 is returned.
07816  */
07817 int
07818 FunctionSymbolExpr::computeOverloadCost(const FunctionType *ftype,
07819                                         const std::vector<const Type *> &argTypes,
07820                                         const std::vector<bool> *argCouldBeNULL,
07821                                         const std::vector<bool> *argIsConstant) {
07822     int costSum = 0;
07823 
07824     // In computing the cost function, we only worry about the actual
07825     // argument types--using function default parameter values is free for
07826     // the purposes here...
07827     for (int i = 0; i < (int)argTypes.size(); ++i) {
07828         // The cost imposed by this argument will be a multiple of
07829         // costScale, which has a value set so that for each of the cost
07830         // buckets, even if all of the function arguments undergo the next
07831         // lower-cost conversion, the sum of their costs will be less than
07832         // a single instance of the next higher-cost conversion.
07833         int costScale = argTypes.size() + 1;
07834 
07835         const Type *fargType = ftype->GetParameterType(i);
07836         const Type *callType = argTypes[i];
07837 
07838         if (Type::Equal(callType, fargType))
07839             // Perfect match: no cost
07840             costSum += 0;
07841         else if (argCouldBeNULL && (*argCouldBeNULL)[i] &&
07842                  lArgIsPointerType(fargType))
07843             // Passing NULL to a pointer-typed parameter is also a no-cost
07844             // operation
07845             costSum += 0;
07846         else {
07847             // If the argument is a compile-time constant, we'd like to
07848             // count the cost of various conversions as much lower than the
07849             // cost if it wasn't--so scale up the cost when this isn't the
07850             // case..
07851             if (argIsConstant == NULL || (*argIsConstant)[i] == false)
07852                 costScale *= 128;
07853 
07854             // For convenience, normalize to non-const types (except for
07855             // references, where const-ness matters).  For all other types,
07856             // we're passing by value anyway, so const doesn't matter.
07857             const Type *callTypeNC = callType, *fargTypeNC = fargType;
07858             if (CastType<ReferenceType>(callType) == NULL)
07859                 callTypeNC = callType->GetAsNonConstType();
07860             if (CastType<ReferenceType>(fargType) == NULL)
07861                 fargTypeNC = fargType->GetAsNonConstType();
07862                 
07863             if (Type::Equal(callTypeNC, fargTypeNC))
07864                 // Exact match (after dealing with references, above)
07865                 costSum += 1 * costScale;
07866             // note: orig fargType for the next two...
07867             else if (lIsMatchToNonConstReference(callTypeNC, fargType))
07868                 costSum += 2 * costScale;
07869             else if (lIsMatchToNonConstReferenceUnifToVarying(callTypeNC, fargType))
07870                 costSum += 4 * costScale;
07871             else if (lIsMatchWithTypeWidening(callTypeNC, fargTypeNC))
07872                 costSum += 8 * costScale;
07873             else if (lIsMatchWithUniformToVarying(callTypeNC, fargTypeNC))
07874                 costSum += 16 * costScale;
07875             else if (lIsMatchWithTypeConvSameVariability(callTypeNC, fargTypeNC))
07876                 costSum += 32 * costScale;
07877             else if (CanConvertTypes(callTypeNC, fargTypeNC))
07878                 costSum += 64 * costScale;
07879             else
07880                 // Failure--no type conversion possible...
07881                 return -1;
07882         }
07883     }
07884 
07885     return costSum;
07886 }
07887 
07888 
07889 bool
07890 FunctionSymbolExpr::ResolveOverloads(SourcePos argPos,
07891                                      const std::vector<const Type *> &argTypes,
07892                                      const std::vector<bool> *argCouldBeNULL,
07893                                      const std::vector<bool> *argIsConstant) {
07894     const char *funName = candidateFunctions.front()->name.c_str();
07895 
07896     triedToResolve = true;
07897 
07898     // Functions with names that start with "__" should only be various
07899     // builtins.  For those, we'll demand an exact match, since we'll
07900     // expect whichever function in stdlib.ispc is calling out to one of
07901     // those to be matching the argument types exactly; this is to be a bit
07902     // extra safe to be sure that the expected builtin is in fact being
07903     // called.
07904     bool exactMatchOnly = (name.substr(0,2) == "__");
07905 
07906     // First, find the subset of overload candidates that take the same
07907     // number of arguments as have parameters (including functions that
07908     // take more arguments but have defaults starting no later than after
07909     // our last parameter).
07910     std::vector<Symbol *> actualCandidates = 
07911         getCandidateFunctions(argTypes.size());
07912 
07913     int bestMatchCost = 1<<30;
07914     std::vector<Symbol *> matches;
07915     std::vector<int> candidateCosts;
07916 
07917     if (actualCandidates.size() == 0)
07918         goto failure;
07919 
07920     // Compute the cost for calling each of the candidate functions
07921     for (int i = 0; i < (int)actualCandidates.size(); ++i) {
07922         const FunctionType *ft = 
07923             CastType<FunctionType>(actualCandidates[i]->type);
07924         AssertPos(pos, ft != NULL);
07925         candidateCosts.push_back(computeOverloadCost(ft, argTypes,
