07926                                                      argCouldBeNULL,
07927                                                      argIsConstant));
07928     }
07929 
07930     // Find the best cost, and then the candidate or candidates that have
07931     // that cost.
07932     for (int i = 0; i < (int)candidateCosts.size(); ++i) {
07933         if (candidateCosts[i] != -1 && candidateCosts[i] < bestMatchCost)
07934             bestMatchCost = candidateCosts[i];
07935     }
07936     // None of the candidates matched
07937     if (bestMatchCost == (1<<30))
07938         goto failure;
07939     for (int i = 0; i < (int)candidateCosts.size(); ++i) {
07940         if (candidateCosts[i] == bestMatchCost)
07941             matches.push_back(actualCandidates[i]);
07942     }
07943 
07944     if (matches.size() == 1) {
07945         // Only one match: success
07946         matchingFunc = matches[0];
07947         return true;
07948     }
07949     else if (matches.size() > 1) {
07950         // Multiple matches: ambiguous
07951         Error(pos, "Multiple overloaded functions matched call to function "
07952               "\"%s\"%s.", funName, 
07953               exactMatchOnly ? " only considering exact matches" : "");
07954         lPrintOverloadCandidates(argPos, matches, argTypes, argCouldBeNULL);
07955         return false;
07956     }
07957     else {
07958         // No matches at all
07959  failure:
07960         Error(pos, "Unable to find any matching overload for call to function "
07961               "\"%s\"%s.", funName, 
07962               exactMatchOnly ? " only considering exact matches" : "");
07963         lPrintOverloadCandidates(argPos, candidateFunctions, argTypes, 
07964                                  argCouldBeNULL);
07965         return false;
07966     }
07967 }
07968 
07969 
07970 Symbol *
07971 FunctionSymbolExpr::GetMatchingFunction() {
07972     return matchingFunc;
07973 }
07974 
07975 
07976 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
07977 // SyncExpr
07978 
07979 const Type *
07980 SyncExpr::GetType() const {
07981     return AtomicType::Void;
07982 }
07983 
07984 
07985 llvm::Value *
07986 SyncExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
07987     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
07988     ctx->SyncInst();
07989     return NULL;
07990 }
07991 
07992 
07993 int
07994 SyncExpr::EstimateCost() const {
07995     return COST_SYNC;
07996 }
07997 
07998 
07999 void
08000 SyncExpr::Print() const {
08001     printf("sync");
08002     pos.Print();
08003 }
08004

08007 SyncExpr::TypeCheck() {
08008     return this;
08009 }

08013 SyncExpr::Optimize() {
08014     return this;

08022 NullPointerExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
08023     return llvm::ConstantPointerNull::get(LLVMTypes::VoidPointerType);
08024 }

08029     return PointerType::Void;

08044 
08045 llvm::Constant *
08046 NullPointerExpr::GetConstant(const Type *type) const {
08047     const PointerType *pt = CastType<PointerType>(type);
08048     if (pt == NULL)
08049         return NULL;
08050 
08051     llvm::Type *llvmType = type->LLVMType(g->ctx);
08052     if (llvmType == NULL) {
08053         AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
08054         return NULL;
08055     }
08056 
08057     return llvm::Constant::getNullValue(llvmType);
08058 }
08059 
08060 
08061 void
08062 NullPointerExpr::Print() const {
08063     printf("NULL");
08064     pos.Print();
08065 }
08066 
08067 
08068 int
08069 NullPointerExpr::EstimateCost() const {
08070     return 0;
08071 }
08072 
08073 
08074 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
08075 // NewExpr
08076 
08077 NewExpr::NewExpr(int typeQual, const Type *t, Expr *init, Expr *count, 
08078                  SourcePos tqPos, SourcePos p)
08079     : Expr(p) {
08080     allocType = t;
08081 
08082     initExpr = init;
08083     countExpr = count;
08084 
08085     /* (The below cases actually should be impossible, since the parser
08086        doesn't allow more than a single type qualifier before a "new".) */
08087     if ((typeQual & ~(TYPEQUAL_UNIFORM | TYPEQUAL_VARYING)) != 0) {
08088         Error(tqPos, "Illegal type qualifiers in \"new\" expression (only "
08089               "\"uniform\" and \"varying\" are allowed.");
08090         isVarying = false;
08091     }
08092     else if ((typeQual & TYPEQUAL_UNIFORM) != 0 &&
08093              (typeQual & TYPEQUAL_VARYING) != 0) {
08094         Error(tqPos, "Illegal to provide both \"uniform\" and \"varying\" "
08095               "qualifiers to \"new\" expression.");
08096         isVarying = false;
08097     }
08098     else
08099         // If no type qualifier is given before the 'new', treat it as a
08100         // varying new.
08101         isVarying = (typeQual == 0) || (typeQual & TYPEQUAL_VARYING);
08102 
08103     if (allocType != NULL)
08104         allocType = allocType->ResolveUnboundVariability(Variability::Uniform);
08105 }
08106 
08107 
08108 llvm::Value *
08109 NewExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
08110     bool do32Bit = (g->target.is32Bit || g->opt.force32BitAddressing);
08111 
08112     // Determine how many elements we need to allocate.  Note that this
08113     // will be a varying value if this is a varying new.
08114     llvm::Value *countValue;
08115     if (countExpr != NULL) {
08116         countValue = countExpr->GetValue(ctx);
08117         if (countValue == NULL) {
08118             AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
08119             return NULL;
08120         }
08121     }
08122     else {
08123         if (isVarying) {
08124             if (do32Bit) countValue = LLVMInt32Vector(1);
08125             else         countValue = LLVMInt64Vector(1);
08126         }
08127         else {
08128             if (do32Bit) countValue = LLVMInt32(1);
08129             else         countValue = LLVMInt64(1);
08130         }
08131     }
08132 
08133     // Compute the total amount of memory to allocate, allocSize, as the
08134     // product of the number of elements to allocate and the size of a
08135     // single element.
08136     llvm::Value *eltSize = g->target.SizeOf(allocType->LLVMType(g->ctx), 
08137                                             ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock());
08138     if (isVarying)
08139         eltSize = ctx->SmearUniform(eltSize, "smear_size");
08140     llvm::Value *allocSize = ctx->BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::Mul, countValue,
08141                                                  eltSize, "alloc_size");
08142 
08143     // Determine which allocation builtin function to call: uniform or
08144     // varying, and taking 32-bit or 64-bit allocation counts.
08145     llvm::Function *func;
08146     if (isVarying) {
08147         if (do32Bit)
08148             func = m->module->getFunction("__new_varying32");
08149         else
08150             func = m->module->getFunction("__new_varying64");
08151     }
08152     else {
08153         if (allocSize->getType() != LLVMTypes::Int64Type)
08154             allocSize = ctx->SExtInst(allocSize, LLVMTypes::Int64Type,
08155                                       "alloc_size64");
08156         func = m->module->getFunction("__new_uniform");
08157     }
08158     AssertPos(pos, func != NULL);
08159 
08160     // Make the call for the the actual allocation.
08161     llvm::Value *ptrValue = ctx->CallInst(func, NULL, allocSize, "new");
08162 
08163     // Now handle initializers and returning the right type for the result.
08164     const Type *retType = GetType();
08165     if (retType == NULL)
08166         return NULL;
08167     if (isVarying) {
08168         if (g->target.is32Bit)
08169             // Convert i64 vector values to i32 if we are compiling to a
08170             // 32-bit target.
08171             ptrValue = ctx->TruncInst(ptrValue, LLVMTypes::VoidPointerVectorType,
08172                                       "ptr_to_32bit");
08173 
08174         if (initExpr != NULL) {
08175             // If we have an initializer expression, emit code that checks
08176             // to see if each lane is active and if so, runs the code to do
08177             // the initialization.  Note that we're we're taking advantage
08178             // of the fact that the __new_varying*() functions are
08179             // implemented to return NULL for program instances that aren't
08180             // executing; more generally, we should be using the current
08181             // execution mask for this...
08182             for (int i = 0; i < g->target.vectorWidth; ++i) {
08183                 llvm::BasicBlock *bbInit = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("init_ptr");
08184                 llvm::BasicBlock *bbSkip = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("skip_init");
08185                 llvm::Value *p = ctx->ExtractInst(ptrValue, i);
08186                 llvm::Value *nullValue = g->target.is32Bit ? LLVMInt32(0) :
08187                     LLVMInt64(0);
08188                 // Is the pointer for the current lane non-zero?
08189                 llvm::Value *nonNull = ctx->CmpInst(llvm::Instruction::ICmp,
08190                                                     llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_NE,
08191                                                     p, nullValue, "non_null");
08192                 ctx->BranchInst(bbInit, bbSkip, nonNull);
08193 
08194                 // Initialize the memory pointed to by the pointer for the
08195                 // current lane.
08196                 ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bbInit);
08197                 llvm::Type *ptrType = 
08198                     retType->GetAsUniformType()->LLVMType(g->ctx);
08199                 llvm::Value *ptr = ctx->IntToPtrInst(p, ptrType);
08200                 InitSymbol(ptr, allocType, initExpr, ctx, pos);
08201                 ctx->BranchInst(bbSkip);
08202 
08203                 ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bbSkip);
08204             }
08205         }
08206 
08207         return ptrValue;
08208     }
08209     else {
08210         // For uniform news, we just need to cast the void * to be a
08211         // pointer of the return type and to run the code for initializers,
08212         // if present.
08213         llvm::Type *ptrType = retType->LLVMType(g->ctx);
08214         ptrValue = ctx->BitCastInst(ptrValue, ptrType, 
08215                                     LLVMGetName(ptrValue, "_cast_ptr"));
08216 
08217         if (initExpr != NULL)
08218             InitSymbol(ptrValue, allocType, initExpr, ctx, pos);
08219 
08220         return ptrValue;
08221     }
08222 }
08223 
08224 
08225 const Type *
08226 NewExpr::GetType() const {
08227     if (allocType == NULL)
08228         return NULL;
08229 
08230     return isVarying ? PointerType::GetVarying(allocType) :
08231         PointerType::GetUniform(allocType);
08232 }
08233 
08234 
08235 Expr *
08236 NewExpr::TypeCheck() {
08237     // It's illegal to call new with an undefined struct type
08238     if (allocType == NULL) {
08239         AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
08240         return NULL;
08241     }
08242     if (CastType<UndefinedStructType>(allocType) != NULL) {
08243         Error(pos, "Can't dynamically allocate storage for declared "
08244               "but not defined type \"%s\".", allocType->GetString().c_str());
08245         return NULL;
08246     }
08247 
08248     // Otherwise we only need to make sure that if we have an expression
08249     // giving a number of elements to allocate that it can be converted to
08250     // an integer of the appropriate variability.
08251     if (countExpr == NULL)
08252         return this;
08253 
08254     const Type *countType;
08255     if ((countType = countExpr->GetType()) == NULL)
08256         return NULL;
08257 
08258     if (isVarying == false && countType->IsVaryingType()) {
08259         Error(pos, "Illegal to provide \"varying\" allocation count with "
08260               "\"uniform new\" expression.");
08261         return NULL;
08262     }
08263 
08264     // Figure out the type that the allocation count should be
08265     const Type *t = (g->target.is32Bit || g->opt.force32BitAddressing) ?
08266         AtomicType::UniformUInt32 : AtomicType::UniformUInt64;
08267     if (isVarying)
08268         t = t->GetAsVaryingType();
08269 
08270     countExpr = TypeConvertExpr(countExpr, t, "item count");
08271     if (countExpr == NULL)
08272         return NULL;
08273 
08274     return this;
08275 }
08276 
08277 
08278 Expr *
08279 NewExpr::Optimize() {
08280     return this;
08281 }
08282 
08283 
08284 void
08285 NewExpr::Print() const {
08286     printf("new (%s)", allocType ? allocType->GetString().c_str() : "NULL");
08287 }
08288 
08289 
08290 int
08291 NewExpr::EstimateCost() const {
08292     return COST_NEW;
08293 }
Generated on Fri Jun 29 2012 08:42:25 for Intel SPMD Program Compiler by   1.7.5.1
